content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Bruce Godfrey (Idaho State Climate Services)</origin><pubdate>1999</pubdate><title>Koppen Climate Classification for the Conterminous United States</title><geoform>raster digital data</geoform><pubinfo><pubplace>Moscow, Idaho</pubplace><publish>Idaho State Climate Services</publish></pubinfo><onlink>http://cloud.insideidaho.org/webApps/util/zip.ashx?fn=http://cloud.insideidaho.org/data/ics/koppen</onlink><ftname Sync="TRUE">koppen_ics</ftname></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>The Koppen Climate Classification grid coverages were produced using gridded estimates of precipitation, temperature, and elevation from the PRISM (Parameter-elevation Regressions on Independent Slopes Model).  The model was developed at Oregon State University and information about the gridded ASCII data sets can be obtained from: http://www.ocs.orst.edu/prism/.</abstract><purpose>To use spatially gridded data from the PRISM project to delineate climate zones based on the Koeppen Climate Classification Criteria.  The criteria used to delineate the zones may be obtained from: http://snow.ag.uidaho.edu/Clim_Map/criteria.html.</purpose><supplinf>Procedures_Used:   1. Aquired the PRISM ASCII files from Oregon Climate Service (http://www.ocs.orst.edu/prism/).  2. Aquired the United State boundary coverage (1:2,000,000) from the GAP Analysis Project Office at the University of Idaho http://www.wildlife.uidaho.edu/). This coverage was orignally obtained by GAP from the ESRI data site (www.esri.com).    3. Ran the main aml (koeppen.aml) to produce the classification.  4. Merged the individual grids into one grid containing the lowest subclasses.</supplinf><langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><rngdates><begdate>1961</begdate><enddate>1990</enddate></rngdates></timeinfo><current>ground condition</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>None planned</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc Sync="TRUE">-127.866621</westbc><eastbc Sync="TRUE">-65.405706</eastbc><northbc Sync="TRUE">51.596582</northbc><southbc Sync="TRUE">22.867291</southbc></bounding><lboundng><leftbc Sync="TRUE">-2354853.393269</leftbc><rightbc Sync="TRUE">2253861.073807</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">268448.296630</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">3171608.037090</topbc></lboundng></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt><themekey>climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere</themekey></theme><theme><themekey>Koppen Climate Classification</themekey><themekt>None</themekt></theme></keywords><accconst>Public</accconst><useconst>This information is not accurate for legal or navigational purposes.  This information is for use by State Climate Services for Idaho.</useconst><datacred>Bruce Godfrey, Idaho State Climate Services.</datacred><native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.535</native><natvform Sync="TRUE">Raster Dataset</natvform></idinfo><dataqual><lineage><srcinfo><srccite><citeinfo><origin>Chris Daly and Wayne Gibson of the Spatial Climate Analysis Service at Oregon State University, George Taylor of the Oregon Climate Service at Oregon State University</origin><title>Climate Data Set for the Conterminous United States</title><geoform>raster digital data</geoform><pubinfo><pubplace>Corvallis, Oregon, USA</pubplace><publish>Spatial Climate Analysis Service, Oregon</publish></pubinfo><onlink>http://www.ocs.orst.edu/prism/</onlink><pubdate>1990s</pubdate></citeinfo></srccite><srctime><timeinfo><rngdates><begdate>1961</begdate><enddate>1990</enddate></rngdates></timeinfo><srccurr>ground condition</srccurr></srctime><typesrc>online</typesrc><srccontr>Gridded climate data.</srccontr><srccitea>PRISM</srccitea></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc>A processing report can be found here:  http://snow.ag.uidaho.edu/Clim_Map/final_report.html</procdesc><srcused>PRISM</srcused><procdate>1999</procdate></procstep><procstep><procdesc>An error in the classes.aml was discovered by Ben Logan at Virginia Tech.  It was discovered in the creation of the B parameters that an "or" should have been an "&".  An "or" was replaced with an "&" on line 3.  Code before error discovered: Class B if (pptsummer70 >= 0.7 & ppt14 < (2 * tavg14 + 28) & temp/tempA <> 1 or ~   pptwinter70 >= 0.7 & ppt14 < (2 * tavg14) & temp/tempA <> 1 or ~   pptsummer70 < 0.7 & ppt14 < (2 * tavg14 + 14) & temp/tempA <> 1 or ~   pptwinter70 < 0.7 & ppt14 < (2 * tavg14 + 14) & temp/tempA <> 1) endif   Code after error corrected: Class B if (pptsummer70 >= 0.7 & ppt14 < (2 * tavg14 + 28) & temp/tempA <> 1 or ~ pptwinter70 >= 0.7 & ppt14 < (2 * tavg14) & temp/tempA <> 1 or ~ pptsummer70 < 0.7 & ppt14 < (2 * tavg14 + 14) & temp/tempA <> 1 & ~ pptwinter70 < 0.7 & ppt14 < (2 * tavg14 + 14) & temp/tempA <> 1) endif</procdesc><procdate>20060320</procdate></procstep></lineage><logic>No report.</logic><complete>No report.</complete></dataqual><spdoinfo><direct>Raster</direct><rastinfo><rasttype>Grid Cell</rasttype><rowcount>703</rowcount><colcount>1116</colcount><vrtcount>1</vrtcount><rastxsz
